newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albanian PM makes first visit to rebel-held south.
newsitem.headline: Albanian PM makes first visit to rebel-held south.

text.p: Prime Minister Bashkim Fino made his first visit on Tuesday to Albania's rebel-held south since insurgents seized control of the region last month.
Reporters said Fino arrived by helicopter in the rebel-held stronghold of Gjirokaster, 30 kms (20 miles) from the Greek border and was welcomed by local leaders.
Fino was greeted by rebel leaders and heavily-armed guards from Gjirokaster and Tepelene to the north. He shook hands with Gjoleke Malaj, who is the rebel boss in Tepelene.
Fino told reporters he was in the region to meet "legal representatives of local power and public order" and he barred the rebels from closed-door talks with the elected officials.
Elected officials have remained in the region but the south has been controlled by rebel-run Committees of Public Salvation since the army was driven out and munitions depots looted in early March.
Fino's office said he would accept requests by the rebel leaders and their committees to meet separately.
